data.title: Jennifer Lopez 25: On the 6 & Beyond
data.meta_description: The 25th anniversary of Jennifer Lopez's multiplatinum debut "On the 6" (1999) has provided an opportunity to discuss her musical past, present and future.
data.text:
On the 6: “Feelin’ So Good” contains a sample of “Set It Off” as performed by Strafe (written by: George Logios and Steven Standard) / “No Me Ames” is a Francesca Alotta and Aleandro Baldi cover of “Non Amarmi,” written by Baldi, Giancarlo Bigazzi and Marco Falagiani; translated from Italian to Spanish by Ignacio Ballesteros / “Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where You’re Going To?)” is a Diana Ross cover, written by Gerry Goffin and Michael Masser.

J.Lo: “I’m Real” contains a sample of “Firecracker” as performed by Yellow Magic Orchestra (written by: Martin Denny) / “Cariño” contains an interpolation of “Sofrito” as written and performed by Ramón “Mongo” Santamaría Rodríguez.

J to tha L-O! The Remixes: “Ain’t It Funny” (Murder Remix) contains a sample of “Flava in Ya Ear” as performed by Craig Mack (written by: Osten S. Harvey Jr. and Craig Mack) / “I’m Gonna Be Alright” (Trackmasters Remix) contains an interpolation of “Why You Wanna Treat Me So Bad?” as written and performed by Club Nouveau (Denzil Foster, Jay King, Thomas McElroy) / “I’m Real” (Murder Remix) contains an interpolation of “Mary Jane” as written and performed by Rick James.

This Is Me…Then: “Still” contains elements of “Set Me Free” as performed by Teddy Pendergrass (written by: LeRoy Bell and Casey James) / “Loving You” contains: a portion of “Juicy Fruit” as written and performed by James Mtume; an interpolation of “Never Give Up on a Good Thing” as performed by George Benson (written by: Michael Garvin and Tom Shapiro) / “I’m Glad” contains a sample of “P.S.K. What Does It Mean?” as written and performed by Schooly D (Jesse Weaver Jr.) / “The One (Versions 1 and 2)” contains an interpolation of “You Are Everything” as performed by The Stylistics (written by: Thom Bell and Linda Creed) / “All I Have” contains a sample of “Very Special” as performed by Debra Laws (written by: William Jeffrey and Lisa Peters) / “Jenny from the Block” contains: portions of “Heaven and Hell Is on Earth” as written and performed by Michael Oliviere; a portion of “South Bronx” as written and performed by Boogie Down Productions (Lawrence “KRS-One” Parker and Scott “DJ Scott La Rock” Sterling; an interpolation of “Hi-Jack” as written and performed by José Fernando Arbex Miró / “You Belong to Me” is a Carly Simon cover, written by Simon and Michael McDonald; it contains a sample of “Catch the Beat” as written and performed by T Ski Valley (Tyrone Cox and Glen Brad Osborne) / “Baby I ♡ U” contains a sample of “Midnight Cowboy” as written and performed by John Barry.

Rebirth: “Get Right” contains a sample of “Soul Power ‘74” as performed by Maceo & the Macks (written by: James Brown) / “Hold You Down” contains elements of “As We Lay” as performed by Shirley Murdock (written by: William Beck and Larry Troutman) / “Whatever You Wanna Do” contains elements of “CON-FUNK-SHUN” as performed by The Nite-Lighters (written by: Delma Anthony Churchill, Harvey Fuqua and Kenny Hawkins).

Como Ama una Mujer: “¿Quién será?” is a Pedro Infante cover written by Luis Demetrio and Pablo Beltrán Ruiz.

Brave: “Hold It Don’t Drop It” contains a sample of “It Only Takes a Minute” as performed by Tavares (written by: Brian Potter and Dennis Lambert) / “Do It Well” contains a sample of “Keep On Truckin’” as performed by Eddie Kendricks (written by: Leonard Caston, Anita Porée and Frank Wilson) / “Gotta Be There” contains a sample of “I Wanna Be Where You Are” as performed by Michael Jackson (written by: Arthur Ross and Leon Ware) / “The Way It Is” contains a sample of “She’s a Lady” as performed by Great Pride (written by: Geonnaro Leone and Bruce Rudd) / “Be Mine” contains a sample of “Sunny” as performed by Paul Mauriat (written by: Bobby Hebb) / “I Need Love” contains a sample of “Use Me” as written and performed by Bill Withers.

Love?: “On the Floor” contains an interpolation of “Llorando se fue” as performed by Kaoma (written by: Gonzalo Hermosa and Ulises Hermosa) / “Take Care” contains: an interpolation and sample of “Rude Boy” as performed by Rihanna (written by: Ester Dean, Robyn Fenty, Tor Erik Hermansen, Mikkel S. Eriksen, Robert Thompson and Makeba Riddick-Woods); elements of “I Like It” as performed by DeBarge (written by: Eldra DeBarge, William DeBarge and Etterlene Jordan).

A.K.A.: “Booty” contains a sample of “Dat a Freak” as performed by Diplo featuring TT the Artist and Lewis Cancut (written by: Lewis D. Gittus, Thomas Wesley Pentz and Tedra Wilson) / “Troubeaux” contains a sample of “Today” as performed by Tom Scott and the California Dreamers (written by: Marty Dalin and Paul Kantner).
